name: Titanium.UI.Label
summary: A text label, with an optional background image.

events.name: link
events.summary: Fired when user interacts with a URL in the Label.
events.description:
The URL is set using the ATTRIBUTE_LINK property on the attributedString.

On Android, this event also fires if the html property is used instead of the attributedString property. This event will also override the default behavior of openning the link in its default application.

On iOS, this is only valid on version 7 and above. In previous versions of the the Titanium SDK this event required a longpress gesture to be performed. Beginning with Titanium SDK 4.0.0, only a singletap gesture is required to invoke this event.

properties.name: url
properties.summary: The URL that is associated with this event.

properties.name: range
properties.summary: An array of two numbers [location, length] describing the character range of the text associated with this URL.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: This is false. This event does not bubble

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

properties.name: focusable
properties.summary: Specify an attributed string for the label.
properties.description:
The underlying attributed string drawn by the label. If set, avoid setting common attributes in the label, such as color and font, as unexpected behaviors may result.

Prior to Release 3.6.0, assign this property an object from the Titanium.UI.iOS.AttributedString class.

Since Appcelerator CLI 4.1.0 (Alloy 1.7.0), for Alloy, you can use an <AttributedString> element inside a <Label> element and set the text property as node text:

<Alloy>
  <Window>
      <Label>
        <AttributedString>
            Alloy is great!
        </AttributedString>
      </Label>
  </Window>
</Alloy>

Then set attributes in the TSS file:

"AttributedString" : {
  attributes: [
    {
      type: Ti.UI.ATTRIBUTE_FOREGROUND_COLOR,
      value: 'red',
      range: [0, 5]
    },
    {
      type: Ti.UI.ATTRIBUTE_UNDERLINES_STYLE,
      value: Ti.UI.ATTRIBUTE_UNDERLINE_STYLE_SINGLE,
      range: [9, 5]
    }
  ]
}

properties.name: autoLink
properties.summary: Automatically convert certain text items in the label to clickable links.
properties.description:
Multiple autolink values can be combined with a bitwise OR. For example:

label.autoLink = Ti.UI.AUTOLINK_MAP_ADDRESSES|Ti.UI.AUTOLINK_PHONE_NUMBERS;

Prior to Release 3.0, this field used platform-specific constants. These are now deprecated in favor of the AUTOLINK constants.

The Android-specific LINKIFY legacy constants are defined in Titanium.UI.Android.

properties.name: backgroundPaddingBottom
properties.summary: Number of pixels to extend the background image past the label on the bottom.

properties.name: backgroundPaddingLeft
properties.summary: Number of pixels to extend the background image past the label on the left.

properties.name: backgroundPaddingRight
properties.summary: Number of pixels to extend the background image past the label on the right.

properties.name: backgroundPaddingTop
properties.summary: Number of pixels to extend the background image past the label on the top.

properties.name: color
properties.summary: Color of the label text, as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description: For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

properties.name: ellipsize
properties.summary: Causes words in the text that are longer than the view is wide to be ellipsized instead of broken in the middle.

properties.name: font
properties.summary: Font to use for the label text.

properties.name: highlightedColor
properties.summary: Color of the label when in the highlighted state, as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description:
For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

Used when the label is part of a view that can be highlighted, such as a Titanium.UI.TableViewRow.

properties.name: html
properties.summary: Simple HTML formatting.

properties.name: includeFontPadding
properties.summary: Includes extra top and bottom padding to make room for accents that go above normal ascent and descent.

properties.name: lines
properties.summary: Makes the label be exactly this many lines tall.

properties.name: lineSpacing
properties.summary: Line spacing of the text, as a dictionary with the properties add and multiply.

properties.name: maxLines
properties.summary: Makes the label at most this many lines tall.

properties.name: minimumFontSize
properties.summary: Minimum font size when the font is sized based on the contents.
properties.description:
When set to a valid font size, this property enables single-line mode and the font will be auto-downscaled so that its text will fit the label's width if necessary. Will not downscale the font lower than the assigned minimum font size.

When set to less than or equal to zero, the font auto-downscaling feature will be disabled.

properties.name: shadowColor
properties.summary: Shadow color of the text, as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description: Use in conjunction with shadowOffset and shadowRadius. For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

properties.name: shadowOffset
properties.summary: Shadow offset of the text, as a dictionary with the properties x and y.

properties.name: shadowRadius
properties.summary: Shadow radius of the text.

properties.name: text
properties.summary: Label text.
properties.description:
Use the backslash and letter n line feed character combination, ie \n, to force a new line.

Use Unicode characters, such as those included in (but not limited to) the Unicode List of Useful Symbols section of wikipedia, to insert special characters and symbols.

See the example in Titanium.UI.Label for a demonstration.

properties.name: textAlign
properties.summary: Text alignment.

properties.name: textid
properties.summary: Key identifying a string from the locale file to use for the label text.
properties.description: Only one of text or textid should be specified.

properties.name: verticalAlign
properties.summary: Vertical text alignment, specified using one of the vertical alignment constants from Titanium.UI.
properties.description:
On iPhone and iPad the default value of the property is undefined. The behavior of the label depends on the actual content height. If the actual content height is larger than the available height the text is truncated at the end and the content is center aligned.

On Android, the default value of the property is undefined, and the default behavior when the property is undefined is to center the text vertically.
properties.default: undefined on Android, iPhone and iPad.

properties.name: wordWrap
properties.summary: Enable or disable word wrapping in the label.
